intro: Lupinus caespitosus var. argophyllus, commonly known as silverleaf lupine, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense,丛生 growth habit and silver-blue foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces tall spikes of purple or blue flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rocky or arid landscapes. Botanically, it is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits soil fertility.
